title: MSCSE.1
text: The student will design and iteratively develop programs that combine control structures, including loops and conditionals.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.2
text: The student will investigate variables and data types, including simple operations on strings.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.3
text: The student will implement a program that accepts input values, stores them in appropriately named variables, and produces output.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.4
text: The student will document programs in order to make them easier to trace, test, and debug.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.5
text: The student will discuss issues of bias and accessibility in the design of existing technologies.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.6
text: The student will describe and explain the history of computer science, including naming significant historical figures and describing their impact on the field.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.7
text: The student will use flowcharts and/or pseudocode to address complex problems as algorithms.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.8
text: The student will incorporate existing code, media, and libraries into original programs, and give attribution.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.9
text: The student will systematically test and refine programs using a range of test cases.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.10
text: The student will model the role of protocols in transmitting data across networks and the Internet.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.11
text: The student will apply multiple methods of encryption to model the secure transmission of information.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.12
text: The student will explain how physical and digital security measures protect electronic information.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.13
text: The student will collect data using computational tools and transform the data to make it more useful and reliable.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.14
text: The student will refine computational models based on the data they have generated.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.15
text: The student will represent data using multiple encoding schemes.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.16
text: The student will compare tradeoffs associated with computing technologies that affect people's everyday activities and career options.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.17
text: The student will collaborate with many contributors through strategies such as crowdsourcing or surveys when creating a computational artifact or visualization.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.18
text: The student will describe tradeoffs between allowing information to be public and keeping information private and secure.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.19
text: The student will systematically identify and correct problems with computing devices and their components.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.20
text: The student will explore the relationship between hardware and software using the Internet of Things.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.21
text: The student will
subject: Computer Science (2017)
subs: work in a team to distribute tasks;
use iterative design to solve problems, including peer review and feedback.

title: MSCSE.22
text: The student will decompose problems and subproblems into parts to facilitate the design, implementation, and review of programs.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.23
text: The student will create procedures with parameters to organize code and make it easier to reuse.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.24
text: The student will recommend improvements to the design of computing devices, based on an analysis of how users interact with the devices.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: MSCSE.25
text: The student will design projects that combine hardware and software components to collect and exchange data.
subject: Computer Science (2017)
